SESWrapperNS::WAnalyzerRegion Struct Reference

Detailed Description

Defines a region to be used for data acquisition.

An analyzer region must have been set through WRP_SetAnalyzerRegion() before starting an acquisition. The previously prepared region can be obtained through the WRP_CheckAnalyzerRegion() function. If the use_binding_energy variable has been set to true, all energies in this struct are assumed to be given as binding energies, otherwise they are kinetic energies. They default to kinetic energies. If binding energies are to be used, the excitation energy must also be set before using this struct.

See also:
WRP_CheckAnalyzerRegion(), WRP_SetAnalyzerRegion(), WRP_SetExcitationEnergy()

Definition at line 58 of file types.h.

Member Data Documentation

double SESWrapperNS::WAnalyzerRegion::centerEnergy_

Specifies the center energy (eV) for fixed mode acquisition (the low and high end energies is calculated from this value and the current pass energy).

bool SESWrapperNS::WAnalyzerRegion::fixed_

Determines if the region will be measured in fixed (true) or swept (false) mode. This is a one-byte boolean. The value can be set to 1 (for true) or 0 (for false).
